revision.text:
{{short description|2018 action film by Prashanth Neel}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Use Indian English|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox film | name = K.G.F: Chapter 1 | image = K.G.F Chapter 1 poster.jpg | caption = Theatrical release poster | director = [[Prashanth Neel]] | producer = Vijay Kiragandur | writer = '''Dialogues:'''
{{plainlist| * Prashanth Neel * Chandramouli M * Vinay Shivangi }} | screenplay = Prashanth Neel | story = Prashanth Neel | cinematography = [[Bhuvan Gowda]] | starring = {{Unbulleted list|[[Yash (actor)|Yash]] | [[Srinidhi Shetty]] | [[Anant Nag]] |[[Malavika Avinash]]| [[Vasishta N. Simha]]}} | narrator = [[Anant Nag]] | music = [[Ravi Basrur]] | editing = Shrikanth | studio = Hombale Films | distributor = {{Unbulleted list|KRG Studios {{Small|(Kannada)}}|[[Excel Entertainment]] & [[AA Films]] {{Small|(Hindi)}}|[[Vishal Film Factory]] {{Small|(Tamil)}}|[[Vaaraahi Chalana Chitram]] {{Small|(Telugu)}}|[[Global United Media]] {{Small|(Malayalam)}} }} | released = {{Film date|df=yes|2018|12|20|United States & Canada|2018|12|21|India}} | runtime = 155 minutes{{cite web |last1=Nathan |first1=Archana |title='KGF' film review: Lots of style and not enough substance |url=https://scroll.in/reel/906565/kgf-film-review-lots-of-style-and-not-enough-substance |website=Scroll.in |accessdate=23 December 2018 |date=21 December 2018}} | country = India | language = Kannada | budget = {{INR|50|link=yes}}–80 [[crore]]{{efn|''[[Hindustan Times]]'' reported the budget as {{INR}}50 crore{{cite web |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/shah-rukh-khan-s-zero-beaten-at-the-box-office-by-kannada-film-kgf-in-photo-finish/story-EC5yZTidmeLLMNTGbPetbI.html |title=Shah Rukh Khan's Zero beaten at the box office by Kannada film KGF in photo finish |work=Hindustan Times |language=en |date=25 December 2018}} whereas ''[[Business Today (India)|Business Today]]'' had an {{INR}}80 crore estimate.{{cite web |url=https://www.businesstoday.in/trending/box-office/kgf-box-office-collection-day-6-hindi-version-yash-movie-picks-up-pace-srk-zero-slows-down/story/304580.html |title=KGF Box Office Collection Day 6: Hindi version of Yash's movie picks up pace as SRK's Zero slows down |work=Business Today |language=en |date=27 December 2018}}}} | gross = {{estimation}} {{INR}}243–250 crore{{cite web |url=https://www.timesnownews.com/entertainment/box-office/article/yash-starrer-kgf-collects-rs-243-10-crore-at-the-worldwide-box-office-in-50-days-will-it-make-rs-250-crore/363115 |title=Kannada Cinema's Pride! Yash starrer KGF collects Rs 243.10 crore at the worldwide box office in 50 days; will it make Rs 250 crore? - Entertainment News |website=www.timesnownews.com}}{{citation|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/amp/movies/regional-cinema/story/yash-reveals-he-has-approached-sanjay-dutt-for-kgf-chapter-2-1452187-2019-02-09 | title=Yash's film KGF: Chapter 1 made Rs 250 crore at the box office worldwide and became a magnum-opus. Now, the makers are busy with pre-production work of KGF: Chapter 2.|date=2019-02-09|work=indiatoday}} }} '''''K.G.F: Chapter 1''''' is a 2018 Indian [[Kannada]]-language [[epic film|epic]] [[Historical period drama|period]] [[action film]]{{cite web |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2018/dec/05/no-technology-can-replace-the-theatrical-experience-1907707.html |title=The story of KGF is fresh and special for Indian cinema: Yash |publisher=[[The New Indian Express]]}}{{cite web |title=Kannada star Yash optimistic about upcoming action-period drama 'KGF' |url=https://www.devdiscourse.com/Article/entertainment/247888-kannada-star-yash-optimistic-about-upcoming-action-period-drama-kgf |website=Devdiscourse |accessdate=3 December 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181203182605/https://www.devdiscourse.com/Article/entertainment/247888-kannada-star-yash-optimistic-about-upcoming-action-period-drama-kgf |archivedate=3 December 2018 |date=11 September 2018 |url-status=live}} written and directed by [[Prashanth Neel]], and produced by Vijay Kiragandur under the banner Hombale films. It is the first {{not a typo|instalment}} in the two-part series, followed by ''[[K.G.F: Chapter 2]]''. The film centres around Raja Krishnappa Bairya "Rocky", born into poverty, who arrives in [[Bombay]] (now Mumbai) in the 1960s, on a quest for power and wealth as desired by his dying mother. Involved with the gold mafia there, he is recruited to kill Garuda, the oppressive heir-in-waiting, in [[Kolar Gold Fields]]. [[Yash (actor)|Yash]] stars as Rocky, while Ramachandra Raju features as Garuda. [[Anant Nag]] narrates the film while also playing a supporting role alongside [[Srinidhi Shetty]], [[Vasishta N. Simha]], Ayyappa P. Sharma and Harish Rai. At the [[66th National Film Awards]], the film won 2 awards for [[Action film|Best Action]] and [[Vfx|Best Special Effects]].{{cite web|url=http://pib.nic.in/newsite/PrintRelease.aspx?relid=192564|title=66th National Film Awards for 2018 announced|publisher=Press Information Bureau Government of India Ministry of Information & Broadcasting}} The development of the film began in early 2015 when Neel completed writing the screenplay.{{cite news |title=Yash And Radhika Pandit To Pair Up Again In KGF! |url=https://www.filmibeat.com/kannada/news/2015/yash-and-radhika-pandit-to-pair-up-again-in-kgf-175889.html |accessdate=25 December 2018 |work=Filmibeat |date=6 March 2015 |language=en}} However, filming began only two years later, in March 2017.{{cite news |title=Yash-starrer KGF starts as per schedule |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2017/mar/16/yash-starrer-kgf-starts-as-per-schedule-1581753.html |accessdate=25 December 2018 |work=The New Indian Express |date=16 March 2017}} Majority of the film is set in Kolar Gold Fields and was filmed on location.{{cite web |title=Yash discusses risks of shooting on a gold mine for KGF |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/yash-discusses-risks-of-shooting-on-gold-mines-for-kgf-5501520/ |website=The Indian Express |accessdate=25 December 2018 |language=en-IN |date=20 December 2018}} [[Bhuvan Gowda]] served as the cinematographer and Shrikanth as the editor. [[Ravi Basrur]] scored music for the soundtrack and the film's background.{{cite web |last1=Kumar |first1=Hemanth |title=KGF: Chapter 1 — Yash, director Prashanth Neel on their upcoming film, and taking cues from SS Rajamouli |url=https://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/kgf-chapter-1-yash-director-prashanth-neel-on-their-upcoming-film-and-taking-cues-from-ss-rajamouli-5738141.html |website=Firstpost |accessdate=25 December 2018 |language=en |date=16 December 2018}} After a North American premiere on 20 December 2018, ''K.G.F: Chapter 1'' was released in Kannada and in dubbed versions of [[Hindi]], [[Telugu language|Telugu]], [[Tamil language|Tamil]] and [[Malayalam]] languages the following day, and received positive response from audiences.{{cite news |last1=Hooli |first1=Shekhar H. |title=KGF movie review: This is what Hindi, Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam audience say about Yash starrer |url=https://www.ibtimes.co.in/kgf-chapter-1-movie-review-rating-by-non-kannada-viewers-live-updates-788451 |accessdate=25 December 2018 |work=International Business Times, India Edition |date=21 December 2018 |language=english}} However, critics gave the film mixed reviews; while they praised the cinematography, art direction and the film's score, the screenplay and editing were criticised. The film performed well commercially and collected {{INR}}76 [[crore]] four days into release, in the process breaking the record for the [[List of highest-grossing Indian films#Kannada|highest grossing Kannada film]] of all time.{{cite web |url=https://www.kannadaprabha.com/cinema/news/kgf-box-office-collection-day-4-yash-film-continues-its-dream-run/330728.html |title=ಕೆಜಿಎಫ್ ಭರ್ಜರಿ ಕಲೆಕ್ಷನ್: 4ನೇ ದಿನಕ್ಕೆ 75 ಕೋಟಿ, ಕನ್ನಡದ ಮಟ್ಟಿಗೆ ಹೊಸ ದಾಖಲೆ! |date=25 December 2018 |access-date=25 December 2018 |language=Kannada |trans-title=KGF Largest Collection: Rs 75 Crore on 4th Day, New Record for Kannada!}} The movie was released online by [[Amazon Prime Video]] on 5 February 2019{{citation|url=https://www.indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/kgf-chapter-1-amazon-prime-india-5567827/lite/|title=KGF to stream on Amazon Prime Video from February 5|date=2019-02-05|work=Indian Express}} which earlier bought the digital rights for ₹18 crores and Colors Kannada bought the satellite rights for an undisclosed record price.{{citation|url=https://newsable.asianetnews.com/entertainment/kgf-digital-rights-sold-to-amazon-prime-for-rs-18-crore-colors-kannada-buys-satellite-rights-pke8er|title=KGF digital rights sold to Amazon Prime for Rs 18 crore, Colors Kannada buys satellite rights|date=2018-12-27|work=Asianet Newsable}} The shooting for ''[[K.G.F: Chapter 2]]'' began on 13 March 2019.{{cite news |last1=Shinde |first1=Prajwal |title=KGF 2: Rocking Star Yash and Director Prashant Neel's Film Takes Off |url=https://www.news18.com/news/movies/kgf-2-rocking-star-yash-and-director-prashant-neel-film-takes-off-2065295.html |accessdate=13 March 2019 |work=News 18 |date=28 March 2019}} == Plot == Journalist Anand Ingalagi's book ''El-Dorado'', that detailed events at the [[Kolar Gold Fields]] between 1951 and present day, has been banned by the Government of India and all published copies burnt. However, a television news channel procures a copy and interviews him circling the events. Ingalagi narrates that [[ore]] of gold was discovered by commissioned government officials in the southern part of India's [[Mysore State]] (in present-day [[Kolar district]], [[Karnataka]]) in 1951. Raja Krishnappa "Rocky" Bairya is also born on the day of the discovery in the [[Mysore (region)|Mysore region]], to a poor and widowed woman.Suryavardhan, one of the workers that accompanied the officials kills the officials. Discerning the increasing demand for gold by the [[Cold War]] belligerents, Suryavardhan deceitfully sets up a company, Narachi, in that land, bought for a lease of 99 years on the pretext of mining [[limestone]]. He has five associates, all of who operate away from KGF: Kamal, the son of a former associate Bharghav; Rajendra Desai, the father of Reena, Andrews, who oversees operations in the [[Konkan]] and [[Malabar Coast]]s; Guru Pandian, a powerful politician and president of the DYSS party; and brother Adheera. However, each of them has their eyes on the mines. Andrews' underboss Shetty is a gold smuggler in [[Bombay]], the city that also has another smuggler, Dubai-based Inayat Khalil's eyes set on. Rocky arrives in Bombay as a ten-year-old on a quest for power and wealth as desired by his dying mother and begins to work for Shetty. He becomes Shetty's right-hand man later and oversees the arrival of [[gold bar]]s from Africa to the Bombay coast with an iron fist, and soon rises in strength and power rivalling that of Shetty's. This attracts Andrews who offers him Bombay in return for assassinating Garuda, the younger son of Suryavardhan, who was seen to inherit KGF after his paralysed father's passing. Rocky accepts the offer and heads to [[Bangalore]] where an event is staged for the purpose. Once there, he witnesses the sheer presence,authority and power that Garuda commands and has the attempt averted. In 1978, at the KGF, a bedridden Suryavardhan announces Garuda as his successor overlooking Adheera, who he wants to serve as the latter's aide. Garuda's ruthless way of functioning aided by his commander Vanaram comes to fore. Rocky soon makes his way into KGF evading a unit of henchmen. Once there, he witnesses the brutality that the slaves are subjected to. Although apathetic at first, he is moved by a couple of incidents involving a cold-blooded killing of a mother and son at the hands of an overseer and the slaves' children hoping that he rises to liberate them. Beginning his attempt at it and to indicate to Desai and his men through informants, Kulkarni and Garuda's virtuous brother Virat, that he was alive, as planned, Rocky engages in a fight with a unit of twenty-one overseers killing each one of them in order to save a blind slave they were to kill. With the act, Rocky emerges as a hero in the slaves' eyes. An alerted Vanaram now informs Garuda who heads toward the mines from his palatial residence. To avert thousands of slaves being killed due to his fury, Virat smothers father Suryavardhan to death and sidetracks Garuda, who rushes back home. At the mines, Rocky seizes the opportunity, conspires and unsuspectingly heads through a tunnel to the site where Garuda has decided to behead three slaves as [[Human sacrifice|offerings]] to a deity. Upon Garuda's return to the site and sacrifice of two slaves, a concealed Rocky emerges and beheads him. The ecstatic slaves accept him as their leader as they cheer him on. The narrator concludes that Rocky intentionally chose KGF as the site to assassinate Garuda, in order to earn the will of an "army of people", the slaves, before he seized KGF to his control but still there are people who are waiting to acquire the throne and how Rocky will face them as one man army and why he was given a death warrant by Prime Minister Ramika Sen will be shown in [[K.G.F: Chapter 2|Chapter 2]]. == Cast == {{div col|colwidth=22em}} * [[Yash (actor)|Yash]] as Raja "Rocky Bhai" Krishnappa Bhairya{{cite web |title='KGF – Chapter 1' film review: Introduces a new superhero |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/review/2018/dec/21/kgf---chapter-1-film-review-introduces-a-new-superhero-1914694.html |website=The New Indian Express |accessdate=22 December 2018 |date=21 December 2018}} ** Anmol Vijay as young Rocky{{cite news |title=Meet the younger version of Yash in KGF |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2018/dec/08/meet-the-younger-version-of-yash-in-kgf-1908708.html |accessdate=22 December 2018 |work=The New Indian Express |date=8 December 2018}} * [[Srinidhi Shetty]] as Reena Desai * Archana Jois as Shanthamma, Rocky's mother{{cite web |last1=Sharadhaa |first1=A. |title='KGF – Chapter 1' film review: Introduces a new superhero |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/review/2018/dec/21/kgf---chapter-1-film-review-introduces-a-new-superhero-1914694.html |website=The New Indian Express |accessdate=23 December 2018 |date=21 December 2018}} * [[Anant Nag]] as Anand Ingalagi ** Ashok Sharma as young Anand Ingalagi * Ramesh Indira as Suryavardhan * Ramachandra Raju as Garuda * Vinay Bidappa as Virat * Laxman as Rajendra Desai * [[Vasishta N. Simha]] as Kamal * [[Achyuth Kumar]] as Guru Pandian * B. S. Avinash as Andrews * Tharak Ponnappa as Daya, Andrews' aide * Dinesh Mangaluru as Shetty * Harish Rai as Khasim, Shetty's aide and Rocky's confidante * Balakrishna as Inayat Khalil * [[T. S. Nagabharana]] as the owner of television news channel ''24/News'' * [[Malavika Avinash]] as Deepa Hegde, the chief editor of ''24/News'' * Govinda Gowda as a peon at ''24/News'' * Mohan Juneja as Nagaraju, an informer to Ingalagi * Ayyappa P. Sharma as Vanaram, commander for KGF * John Kokken as John, an overseer at KGF * Puneeth Rudranag as Rugga, an overseer at mines * Neenasam Ashwath as Kulkarni * B. Suresha as Vittal, a slave at KGF * T. N. Srinivas Murthy as Narayan, a slave at KGF * Lakshmipathi as Kencha, a slave at KGF, the storyteller * Roopa Rayappa as Shanthi, a slave at KGF * Sampath Maitreya as Shanti's Husband *Yashwant Shetty *Shambavi Venkatesh * [[Tamannaah]] as Milky in a special appearance for an item number "Jokae" {{div col end}} ;Hindi version * [[Mouni Roy]] as Lucy in special appearance for an item number "Gali Gali"{{cite news |title=Mouni Roy teases a glimpse of her KGF dance number, Gali Gali. Watch here |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/mouni-roy-teases-a-glimpse-of-her-kfg-dance-number-gali-gali-watch-here/story-HjsohSRSCzx8xOwMOcyb2I.html |accessdate=22 December 2018 |work=Hindustan Times |date=11 December 2018 |language=en}} == Production == The art director Shivakumar recreated the Kolar Gold Fields film set of the 80s and VFX was used as an extension.{{cite news |last1=Shinde |first1=Prajwal |title=Art director and VFX responsible for KGF's larger than life visuals |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2017/oct/27/trio-of-technical-wizards--makes-kgf--best-in-longest-time-1685111.html |accessdate=27 October 2018 |work=Indian Express |date=3 March 2019}} As of 25 June 2017, the project was 50 per cent complete and production had restarted after sets were rebuilt following their destruction by heavy rains.{{cite news |last1=Sharadhaa |first1=A |title=Storm or shine, Rocking star Yash's KGF stays on schedule |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2017/jun/25/storm-or-shine--yashs-kgf--stays-on-schedule-1620820.html |accessdate=30 June 2017 |publisher=The New Indian Express |date=25 June 2017}} ''KGF'' was released in five languages. It is a complete period drama and is set in the 70s and early 80s. Yash grew his beard and long hair for his role as Rocky, a slick and a suave person of the 70s era. Apart from Yash and Srinidhi, some of the Kannada actors include [[Ananthnag]], [[Malavika Avinash]], [[Achyuth Kumar]], [[Vasishta N. Simha]]{{cite web |title=Vasishta N Simha bags a pivotal role in KGF |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/kannada/movies/news/vasishta-n-simha-bags-a-pivotal-role-in-kgf/articleshow/60243550.cms |author=Sunayana Suresh |date=28 August 2017 |website=timesofindia.indiatimes.com |accessdate=24 November 2018}} and B Suresha. [[Ramya Krishnan|Ramya Krishna]] and [[Nassar (actor)|Nassar]] were falsely reported to be a part of the film.{{cite web |title=KGF to be multilingual, will release in five languages |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/kannada/movies/news/kgf-to-be-amultilingual-will-release-in-five-languages/articleshow/60257321.cms |author=Sunayana Suresh |date=29 August 2017 |website=timesofindia.indiatimes.com |accessdate=24 November 2018}} The teaser of KGF was released on Yash's birthday, 8 January 2018. The trailer was released on 9 November 2018.{{cite web |url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/watch-kgf-trailer-out-meet-yash-rocky-91271 |title=Watch: 'KGF' trailer out, meet Yash as Rocky |date=9 November 2018 |website=thenewsminute.com |accessdate=24 November 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/regional-cinema/story/kgf-trailer-yash-1385765-2018-11-10 |title=KGF trailer out: Yash stars in biggest Kannada film ever made |date=10 November 2018 |website=indiatoday.in |accessdate=24 November 2018}}{{cite web |url=https://www.business-standard.com/article/news-ians/i-m-a-newcomer-for-pan-india-audiences-kgf-actor-yash-118111200761_1.html |title=I'm a newcomer for pan-India audiences: 'KGF' actor Yash |date=12 November 2018 |website=business-standard.com |accessdate=24 November 2018}} Rocky's character was inspired by [[Amitabh Bachchan]]'s ''[[Sholay]]''.{{cite|url=https://www.deccanherald.com/metrolife/sholay-70s-films-inspired-kgf-711051.html|title='Sholay', '70s films inspired 'KGF': Director Neel|first=Nina|last=George|date=2019-02-01|work=Deccan Herald}} It had also inspiration from [[action movies]] and [[western movies]]{{cite|url=https://scroll.in/reel/906039/kannada-film-kgf-dreams-big-cinema-is-becoming-pan-indian-and-international|title=Kannada film ‘KGF’ dreams big: ‘Cinema is becoming pan-Indian and international’|first=Archana|last=Nathan|date=2018-12-18|work=Scroll}} like ''[[The Good, the Bad and the Ugly]]'' and ''[[For a Few Dollars More]]''.{{citation|url=https://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2018/dec/13/i-wondered-if-i-could-pull-off-a-project-as-big-as-kgf-1910707.html|title=I wondered if I could pull off a project as big as KGF|first=Shraddha|last=A|date=2018-12-13|work=The New Indian Express}} == Soundtrack == {{Main|K.G.F: Chapter 1 (soundtrack)}} [[Ravi Basrur]] composed the soundtrack album and the film's score, while [[Tanishk Bagchi]] [[remaster]]ed the track "Gali Gali" from ''[[Tridev]]'' (1989) for the film's Hindi version, and [[D. Imman]] composed the karaoke versions of the songs.{{cite news |title=KGF Chapter 1 Song Gali Gali: Mouni Roy Headlines the Remixed Tridev Song |url=https://www.news18.com/news/movies/kgf-chapter-1-song-gali-gali-mouni-roy-headlines-the-remixed-tridev-song-1972393.html |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=News18 |date=14 December 2018}} The audio rights of the film were purchased by [[Lahari Music]] in Kannada, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam for {{INR}}3.6 crore, a record sum for any South Indian film, except the Hindi version which was bought by [[T-Series (company)|T-Series]].{{cite news |last1=Khajane |first1=Muralidhara |title='KGF' audio rights sold for record sum |url=https://www.thehindu.com/news/cities/bangalore/kgf-audio-rights-sold-for-record-sum/article25593109.ece |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=The Hindu |date=26 November 2018 |language=en-IN}} All the songs were released as singles, and all versions of the first track of the album "Salaam Rocky Bhai", was released on 4 December 2018, except the Hindi version which was released on 7 December 2018.{{cite news |last1=Upadhyaya |first1=Prakash |title=KGF first single: Salaam Rocky Bhai song from Yash's film is out [Lyrical Video] |url=https://www.ibtimes.co.in/kgf-first-single-salaam-rocky-bhai-song-yash-out-tuesday-lyrical-video-787081 |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=International Business Times, India Edition |date=4 December 2018 |language=english}} The complete soundtrack album of the film was released on 19 December 2018, in all South Indian languages and the soundtrack for the Hindi version was released on 26 December 2018. The karaoke versions of the songs were released on 9 January 2019. The film's score was released in two volumes. Volume 1 was released on 10 September 2019, and second volume was released on 12 October 2019. == Release == ''K.G.F: Chapter 1'' received a U/A certificate from the [[Central Board of Film Certification]] in early December 2018.{{cite news |author=Abhijith |title=Yash Starrer KGF: Chapter 1 Gets U/A Certificate From Censor Board! |url=https://www.filmibeat.com/kannada/news/2018/yash-starrer-kgf-chapter-1-gets-u-a-certificate-from-censor-board-280278.html |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=Filmibeat |date=8 December 2018 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181223052911/https://www.filmibeat.com/kannada/news/2018/yash-starrer-kgf-chapter-1-gets-u-a-certificate-from-censor-board-280278.html |archivedate=23 December 2018 |language=en}}{{cite web |title=Yash is like a brother from another mother: Vishal |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/tamil/yash-brother-from-another-mother-vishal-kgf-5500142/ |website=The Indian Express |accessdate=23 December 2018 |language=en-IN |date=19 December 2018}} The [[Film distribution|distribution]] rights for the Kannada version were bought by KRG Studios, a sister company of the film's studio Hombale Films. While [[Excel Entertainment]] and [[AA Films]] bought rights for the Hindi version, the Tamil version's rights were sold to [[Vishal Film Factory]], Telugu to [[Vaaraahi Chalana Chitram]] and Malayalam to [[Global United Media]].{{cite news |title=Leading distributors bag Tamil, Telugu rights to KGF |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2018/nov/08/leading-distributors-bag-tamil-telugu-rights-to-kgf-1895344.html |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=The New Indian Express |date=8 November 2018}}{{cite news |title=Yash's multilingual 'KGF' to hit 2,000 screens across the country |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2018/dec/15/kgf----chapter-1--to-hit-2000-screens-across-the-country-1911670.html |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=The New Indian Express |date=15 December 2018}} The film was released in the U.S. and Canada on 20 December 2018 and in India the following day.{{cite news |title=Yash's 'KGF' to release in more than 1,800 screens across the country |url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/yash-s-kgf-release-more-1800-screens-across-country-93512https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/yash-s-kgf-release-more-1800-screens-across-country-93512 |accessdate=21 December 2018 |work=The News Minute |date=17 December 2018}} The day also saw releases in parts of Africa, Hong Kong and parts of Eastern Europe including Cyprus, the first in these regions for a Kannada film.{{cite news |title=KGF collection Day 2: Yash's magnum opus works its magic at the box office |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/yash-kgf-box-office-collection-day-2-5505351/ |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=The Indian Express |date=23 December 2018 |language=en-IN}} It was reported that the film would be released in 1,800–2,200 screens worldwide, the widest ever release for a Kannada film.{{cite news |last1=Mankad |first1=Himesh |title=K.G.F: Chapter 1, starring Yash, Srinidhi Shetty, to release on 2200 screens across India |url=https://bangaloremirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/south-masala/k-g-f-chapter-1-starring-yash-srinidhi-shetty-to-release-on-2200-screens-across-india/articleshow/67177621.cms |accessdate=21 December 2018 |work=[[Bangalore Mirror]] |date=20 December 2018}}{{cite news |title=Yash's KGF to hit 2,000 screens across the country |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/kannada/movies/news/yashs-kgf-to-hit-2000-screens-across-the-country/articleshow/67113112.cms |accessdate=21 December 2018 |work=The Times of India |date=20 December 2018}}{{cite news |title=400 theatres in Karnataka, 1500 in country: Yash's 'KGF' set for big release |url=https://www.thenewsminute.com/article/400-theatres-karnataka-1500-country-yash-s-kgf-set-big-release-93685 |accessdate=21 December 2018 |work=The News Minute |date=20 December 2018}} However, it was later reported that the film was released in 2,460 screens, that included 1,500 for the Hindi version, 400 each for Kannada and Telugu, 100 for Tamil and 60 for Malayalam.{{cite news |title=KGF box office collection Day 1: Yash film earns Rs 18.1 crore |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/kgf-box-office-collection-day-1-yash-5504127/ |accessdate=22 December 2018 |work=The Indian Express |date=22 December 2018 |language=en-IN}} The Hindi-dubbed version of the film was released in 71 screens in Pakistan on 11 January and became the first Kannada film to be released there, although ''[[Lucia (film)|Lucia]]'' (2013) was screened at [[film festival]]s and did not see a theatrical release in the country.{{cite news |title=Yash-starrer KGF becomes first Kannada film to release in Pakistan |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2019/jan/13/yash-starrer-kgf-released-in-pakistan-1924639.html |accessdate=17 January 2019 |work=The New Indian Express |date=13 January 2019}}{{cite news |title=Rocky Bhai gets a thumbs up in Pakistan |url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/entertainment/kannada/2019/jan/15/rocky-bhai-gets-a-thumbs-up-in-pakistan-1925085.html |accessdate=17 January 2019 |work=The New Indian Express |date=15 January 2019}} ==Reception== === Critical reception === ''K.G.F: Chapter 1'' received positive response from audiences while critics gave the film mixed reviews.{{cite news |title=KGF box office collection Day 1: Yash film earns Rs 18.1 crore |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/kgf-box-office-collection-day-1-yash-5504127/ |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=The Indian Express |date=22 December 2018 |language=en-IN}} While its cinematography, [[Art director|art direction]], narration, stunt sequences, background score and acting performances received acclamation, critics had mixed comments about the screenplay, dialogues and editing.{{cite news |title=Rocking Star Yash's 'KGF' gets a positive response from fans and audiences |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/kannada/movies/news/rocking-star-yashs-kgf-gets-a-positive-response-from-fans-and-audiences/articleshow/67191968.cms |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=The Times of India |date=21 December 2018}} Reviewing for ''[[Deccan Herald]]'', Vivek M. V. felt that that the "grandeur" lay in the film's "fantastically gripping story". He wrote praises of the film's narration, its "brilliant" editing and "riveting sequences".{{cite web |last1=M. V. |first1=Vivek |title='KGF' movie review: Kannada cinema enters big leagues |url=https://www.deccanherald.com/entertainment/dh-talkies/kgf-movie-review-kannada-709204.html |website=Deccan Herald |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en |date=21 December 2018}} Sunayana Suresh of ''[[The Times of India]]'' gave the film rating of three-and-a-half out of five and wrote that it had a "fast-paced first half ... but the second half and the climax sets up the right premise for the second part of the film." She called the screenplay narrated in a "non-linear" fashion the "most interesting part of the film". She commended the performance as Yash in that he "lives his character to the fullest".{{cite web |last1=Suresh |first1=Sunayana |title=KGF Review {3.5/5}: 'KGF: Chapter 1' surely seems to have delivered what it set to achieve |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/kannada/movie-reviews/kgf/movie-review/67187039.cms |accessdate=22 December 2018 |date=21 December 2018}} Troy Ribeiro of ''News18'' echoed her sentiment and wrote, "Yash's endurance, strife and sincerity ... get projected as perfunctory" in the context of "tight close-ups and mid-shots the camera stops us from getting emotionally connected to" every actor in the film. He further wrote, "With intense atmospheric lighting, every frame in the film looks aesthetic and natural. Brilliant cinematography and equally challenging action sequences are put together with razor-sharp edits. They give the film a racy pace."{{cite web |title=KGF Review: Brilliant Cinematography, Challenging Action Sequences Give Yash's Film a Racy Pace |url=https://www.news18.com/news/movies/kgf-movie-review-brilliant-cinematography-challenging-action-sequences-give-yash-film-a-racy-pace-1980355.html |website=News18 |accessdate=22 December 2018 |date=22 December 2018}} The reviewer for ''[[Hindustan Times]]'', Priyanka Sundar, called the film a "story of greed and redemption" and remarked that it "burns bright". While praising the "promising" background score, "sharp" editing and "stunning" visuals, she felt that the screenplay could have been "tighter".{{cite web |last1=Sundar |first1=Priyanka |title=KGF Chapter 1 movie review: Yash's movie about goldmine mafia burns bright |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/regional-movies/kgf-chapter-1-movie-review-yash-s-movie-about-goldmine-mafia-burns-bright/story-bWBDTJIQ7wYP2LxvQCZBWJ.html |website=Hindustan Times |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en |date=21 December 2018}} Janani K. of ''[[India Today]]'' felt the film was "dragged and over-stretched" and gave it a three out of five-star rating. While she commended Yash's "extraordinary performance" and the "brilliantly choreographed stunt sequences", she wrote that despite having "universal theme, [the film] gets lost in translation, thanks to sloppy editing and atrocious dialogues."{{cite web |last1=K. |first1=Janani |title=KGF Chapter 1 Movie Review: Sloppy writing spoils Yash's intriguing gangster drama |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/reviews/story/kgf-chapter-1-movie-review-sloppy-writing-spoils-yash-s-intriguing-gangster-drama-1414701-2018-12-21 |website=India Today |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en |date=21 December 2018}} Subha J. Rao of ''[[Firstpost]]'' gave the film a similar rating and praised the film's music, cinematography and art direction; particularly the latter in "bringing alive the grime and heat of the gold mines". However, she felt "[t]ighter editing ... would have smoothened out the kinks" in the film.{{cite web |last1=Rao |first1=Subha J. |title=KGF: Chapter 1 movie review — Yash-starrer has a gripping story that deserved better treatment |url=https://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/kgf-chapter-1-movie-review-yash-starrer-has-a-gripping-story-that-deserved-better-treatment-5770351.html |website=Firstpost |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en |date=21 December 2018}} Shashiprasad S. M. of ''[[Deccan Chronicle]]'' scored the film a two-and-a-half out of five star rating and described the film as "a visual spectacle". Barring that, he felt it fell short of "instilling the much-needed life into it."{{cite web |last1=S. M. |first1=Shashiprasad |title=KGF movie review: Rold gold! |url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/entertainment/movie-reviews/211218/kgf-movie-review-rold-gold.html |website=Deccan Chronicle |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en |date=21 December 2018}} Karthik Keramalu of ''Film Companion'' felt that the film fell short "becoming a great movie by a long mile". He dismissed the dialogues delivered by Yash's character as "lengthy sermon about his own valour", while also criticizing the film's editing.{{cite web |last1=Keramalu |first1=Karthik |title=K.G.F: Chapter 1 Movie Review: Prashanth Neel's Epic Falls Short Of Greatness By A Mile |url=https://www.filmcompanion.in/kgf-chapter1-movie-review-prashanth-neel-yash-srinidhi-shetty-anant-nag/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20181222133626/https://www.filmcompanion.in/kgf-chapter1-movie-review-prashanth-neel-yash-srinidhi-shetty-anant-nag/ |archivedate=22 December 2018 |website=Film Companion |accessdate=22 December 2018 |date=21 December 2018}} Excepting what he described the film's climax as "spectacular with the support of a brilliant cast" and "spot on" sets and location, Muralidhara Khajane of ''[[The Hindu]]'' felt there was "nothing in the film that we have not seen before". While writing that "[t]here is a certain finesse to the edgy, moody cinematography", he concluded that the film lacked a "soul, a believable story and a rounded protagonist."{{cite web |last1=Khajane |first1=Muralidhara |title=KGF review: The pageant is beautiful but meaningless |url=https://www.thehindu.com/entertainment/movies/kgf-review-the-pageant-is-beautiful-but-meaningless/article25805463.ece |website=The Hindu |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en-IN |date=22 December 2018}} Manoj Kumar R. of ''[[The Indian Express]]'' scored the film two-and-a-half out of five stars and deemed it "[a]n overstretched exercise in hero worship". While drawing comparisons of certain scenes to those from ''[[Baahubali (franchise)|Baahubali]]'', he felt the film had a "flimsy storyline", which he added is made up for by "terrific background orchestra".{{cite web |last1=Kumar R. |first1=Manoj |title=KGF movie review: An overstretched exercise in hero worship |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/movie-review/kgf-movie-review-rating-yash-5503903/ |website=The Indian Express |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en-IN |date=21 December 2018}} Also writing for the same news publication, Shubhra Gupta drew comparisons of the film in plot to those of ''[[Nayakan]]'', ''[[Deewaar]]'', ''[[Parinda]]'' in its first half. She felt that the film had "nothing more" than "striking cinematography, and the brown and sepia colours which suffuse the screen".{{cite web |last1=Gupta |first1=Shubhra |title=KGF review: The movie is just a star vehicle |url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/regional/kgf-review-yash-rating-5504053/ |website=The Indian Express |accessdate=22 December 2018 |language=en-IN |date=21 December 2018}} The character of Rocky was well received by critics. Janani K of [[India Today]] said that "You take a look at [Rocky] and instantly you know that this guy will do the impossible and pull people out of their misery."{{citation|url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/reviews/story/kgf-chapter-1-movie-review-sloppy-writing-spoils-yash-s-intriguing-gangster-drama-1414701-2018-12-21|title=KGF Chapter 1 Movie Review: Sloppy writing spoils Yash's intriguing gangster drama|first=Janani|last=K|date=2018-12-21|work=India Today}} Sunaina Suresh of [[Times of India]] said that "The growth of Rocky is shown steadily and the makers kept a clever story telling pattern right through, that keeps pace with the narrative." And further added that "The first chapter shows Rocky as the maverick mastermind who will stop at nothing in order to achieve his mission."{{citation|url=https://m.timesofindia.com/entertainment/telugu/movie-reviews/kgf/movie-review/67189988.cms|title=KGF review|date=2018-12-23|first=Sunaina|last=Suresh|work=Times of India}} Troy Ribeiro of [[News 18]] said that "Rocky is the new Superhero in the town."{{citation|url=https://www.news18.com/news/movies/kgf-movie-review-brilliant-cinematography-challenging-action-sequences-give-yash-film-a-racy-pace-1980355.html|title=KGF Movie Review: Brilliant Cinematography, Challenging Action Sequences|first=Troy|last=Ribeiro|date=2018-12-22|work=News 18}} == Box office == {{see also|List of highest-grossing Indian films}} ''KGF: Chapter 1'' on the first day of its release collected ₹25 crore worldwide, which was the highest opening ever in history of Kannada film industry, In Karnataka's capital [[Bengaluru]] itself, the film has earned about ₹5 crore on day 1.{{Cite web |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/amp/movies/regional-cinema/story/kgf-box-collection-day-1-yash-s-film-opens-well-but-it-is-no-baahubali-1415091-2018-12-22 |title=KGF box collection day 1: Yash's film opens well but it is no Baahubali |website=India Today}} First weekend collections stood around ₹60 crore worldwide from all its versions.KGF box office collection day 3 total: Yash starrer earns whopping Rs 59.6 crore! Looks set to break records via zeebiz – https://www.zeebiz.com/india/photo-gallery-kgf-box-office-collection-day-3-worldwide-another-record-smashed-yash-srinidhi-starrer-makes-most-of-christmas-mood-77219 The film grossed around ₹113 crore worldwide in the first week of its release and it went on to become the first film to cross ₹100 crore mark in the history of Kannada film industry.KGF box office collection Day 7: Yash-starrer inches towards Rs 150-crore mark – Movies News – https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/regional-cinema/story/kgf-box-office-collection-day-7-yash-starrer-inches-towards-rs-150-crore-mark-1418731-2018-12-28 And it has grossed over ₹250 crore in 50-days and emerged as an all-time eight highest-grossing south Indian film at Indian box office ''K.G.F: Chapter 1'', completed its theatrical run over 100-days in couple of centres of [[Karnataka]] and [[Andhra Pradesh|AP/Telangana]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.financialexpress.com/entertainment/kgf-movie-chapter-1-chapter-2-cast-trailer-box-office/1534562/|title=K.G.F: Chapter 1 completes 100 days at theaters, becomes biggest blockbuster in history of Kannada movies|date=1 April 2019}} == Trivia == * It became the first [[Kannada language|Kannada]] film to cross ₹100, ₹200 and ₹250 crore at the Indian box office.{{citation|url=https://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/kgf-becomes-first-kannada-film-to-break-into-rs-200-cr-club-njan-prakashan-declared-blockbuster-5862501.html/amp|title=KGF becomes first Kannada film to break into Rs 200 cr club; Njan Prakashan declared blockbuster|date=2019-01-09|archivedate=2018-01-13|work=Firstpost|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190113152018/https://www.firstpost.com/entertainment/kgf-becomes-first-kannada-film-to-break-into-rs-200-cr-club-njan-prakashan-declared-blockbuster-5862501.html/amp}} * ''K.G.F: Chapter 1'' became the fourth highest grossing [[Hindi language|Hindi]] dubbed film after the [[Baahubali (franchise)|''Baahubali'' franchise]] and [[2.0 (film)|''2.0'']].{{citation|url=https://www.timesnownews.com/amp/entertainment/box-office/article/kgf-box-office-collection-day-21-yash-starrer-earns-rs-40-39-crore-becomes-the-4th-highest-grossing-dubbed-hindi-film-of-all-time/346030|title=KGF BO collection day 21: Yash starrer earns Rs 40.39 crore; becomes 4th highest grossing dubbed Hindi film|date=2019-01-11|archivedate=2019-01-13|work=Times Now|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190113153020/https://www.timesnownews.com/amp/entertainment/box-office/article/kgf-box-office-collection-day-21-yash-starrer-earns-rs-40-39-crore-becomes-the-4th-highest-grossing-dubbed-hindi-film-of-all-time/346030}} * ''K.G.F'' was the first [[Kannada cinema|Sandalwood film]] to cross half million ($500k) dollar in [[United States]] and cumulative $1.5 million dollar in overseas.{{Cite web|url=https://www.ibtimes.co.in/kgf-box-office-collection-day-15-yash-starrer-enters-third-week-us-789368|title=KGF box office collection day 15: Yash-starrer enters third week in the US|first=Prakash|last=Upadhyaya|date=5 January 2019|website=International Business Times, India Edition}} ==Accolades== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Year ! Ceremony ! Category ! Recipient(s) and nominee(s) ! Result ! {{tooltip|Ref.|Reference(s)}} |- | rowspan="2"|2018 !scope="row" rowspan="2" | [[Karnataka State Film Awards]] | [[Karnataka State Film Award for Best Music Director|Best Music Director]] | [[Ravi Basrur]] | {{Won}} | rowspan="2" |{{Cite web|url=https://bangaloremirror.indiatimes.com/entertainment/south-masala/karnataka-state-film-awards-2018-raghavendra-rajkumar-and-meghana-raj-bag-top-honours-check-out-all-winners/articleshow/73186197.cms|title=Karnataka State Film Awards 2018: Raghavendra Rajkumar and Meghana Raj bag top honours; check out all winners|date=10 January 2020|work=Bangalore Mirror}} |- | [[Karnataka State Film Award for Best Art Direction|Best Art Director]] | Shiva Kumar K | {{Won}} |- | rowspan="8"|2019 !scope="row" rowspan="8" | [[Zee Kannada|Zee Kannada Hemmeya Kanndiga Awards]] | Best Film |''K.G.F'' | {{Won}} | rowspan="8" |{{Cite web|url=https://www.filmibeat.com/kannada/news/2019/kgf-wins-highest-awards-at-zee-kannada-awards-2019-yash-says-kgf-chapter-2-will-make-prequel-look-sm-284229.html|title=KGF Wins Highest Awards At Zee Kannada Awards 2019 | Yash Says KGF Chapter 2 Will Make The KGF Look Small - Filmibeat|date=25 March 2019|website=www.filmibeat.com}}https://www.zeekannada.zee5.com/hemmeya-kannadiga-awards-2019-winners-list-a-big-win-for-rachitha-ram-yash-and-chikkana/amp/ |- | Best Director | [[Prashanth Neel]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Actor | [[Yash (actor)|Yash]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Cinematographer |[[Bhuvan Gowda]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Music Director | [[Ravi Basrur]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Villain | Ramachandra Raju | {{Won}} |- | Best Lyrisist | [[Nagendra Prasad]] | {{Won}} |- | Voice Of The Year | [[Vijay Prakash]] | {{Won}} |- | rowspan="2"|2019 ! scope="row" rowspan="2" | [[66th National Film Awards]] | [[National Film Award for Best Special Effects|Best Special Effects]] | Unifi Media | {{Won}} | rowspan="2"|{{cite news |title=National Film Awards 2019 LIVE Updates: Ayushmann, Vicky, Keerthy are Best Actors |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/movies/story/national-film-awards-2019-live-updates-1579101-2019-08-09 |accessdate=24 August 2019 |work=India Today |date=9 August 2019 |language=en}} |- | Best Stunt Choreographer | Vikram More, [[Anbariv]] | {{Won}} |- | rowspan="11"|2019 ! scope="row" rowspan="11" | [[South Indian International Movie Awards|SIIMA Awards]] | Best Film | ''K.G.F'' | {{Won}} | rowspan="11"|{{Cite web|url=https://www.deccanchronicle.com/amp/entertainment/bollywood/160819/siima-awards-2019-vijay-yash-keerthi-kgf-win-big-heres-full-winn.html|title=SIIMA Awards 2019: Vijay, Yash, Keerthi, KGF win big, here's full winners list|work=Deccan Chronicle}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.pinkvilla.com/entertainment/south/siima-awards-2019-kgf-star-yash-pulls-suave-look-all-blue-attire-and-wins-best-actor-award-468093?amp|title=SIIMA Awards 2019: KGF star Yash pulls off a suave look in an all blue attire and wins Best Actor Award | PINKVILLA|website=www.pinkvilla.com}} |- | Best Actor | [[Yash (actor)|Yash]] | {{Won}} |- | Pantaloons style icon male of the year | [[Yash (actor)|Yash]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Director | [[Prashanth Neel]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Villain | Ramachandra Raju | {{nom}} |- | Best Debut Actress | [[Srinidhi Shetty]] | {{nom}} |- | Best Supporting Actress | Archana Jois | {{Won}} |- | Best Cinematographer | Bhuvan Gowda | {{Won}} |- | Best Music | [[Ravi Basrur]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Supporting actor - Male | [[Achyuth Kumar]] | {{Won}} |- | Best Playback Singer - Male | [[Vijay Prakash]] | {{won}} |- | rowspan="5"|2019 ! scope="row" rowspan="5"| [[66th Filmfare Awards South|Filmfare Awards South]] | [[Filmfare Award for Best Film – Kannada|Best Film – Kannada]] | ''K.G.F: Chapter 1'' | {{Won}} | rowspan="5"|{{cite web|url=https://www.filmfare.com/features/nominations-for-the-66th-filmfare-awards-south-2019_-37931.html|title=Nominations for the 66th Filmfare Awards (South) 2019|website=[[Filmfare]]|accessdate=20 December 2019}} |- | [[Filmfare Award for Best Director – Kannada|Best Director – Kannada]] | [[Prashanth Neel]] | {{Nom}} |- | [[Filmfare Award for Best Actor – Kannada|Best Actor – Kannada]] | [[Yash (actor)|Yash]] | {{Won}} |- | [[Filmfare Award for Best Music Director – Kannada|Best Music Director – Kannada]] | [[Ravi Basrur]] | {{Nom}} |- | Best Female Debut | Srinidhi Shetty | {{Nom}} |} == See also == * [[List of films featuring slavery]] * [[Mining in India]] == Notes == {{Notelist}} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|7838252}} * {{Rotten Tomatoes|kgf}} {{National Film Award Best Special Effects|state=collapsed}} {{Prashanth Neel}} {{AA Films}} {{Vishal Film Factory}} [[Category:2010s Kannada-language films]] [[Category:2010s action drama films]] [[Category:Indian films about revenge]] [[Category:Films featuring an item number]] [[Category:Films set in the 1970s]] [[Category:Films set in the 1980s]] [[Category:Indian action drama films]] [[Category:Films that won the Best Special Effects National Film Award]] [[Category:Indian films]] [[Category:Period action films]] [[Category:Masala films]] [[Category:Indian pregnancy films]] [[Category:Films set in Mumbai]] [[Category:Films shot in Mumbai]] [[Category:Films set in Karnataka]] [[Category:Films shot in Karnataka]] [[Category:Mining in film]] [[Category:Cold War films]] [[Category:Films set in 1978]] [[Category:Films about Indian slavery]]
